name: isa-l-crypto

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
ISA-L_crypto is a collection of optimized low-level functions targeting
storage applications. ISA-L_crypto includes: - Multi-buffer hashes - run
multiple hash jobs together on one core for much better throughput than
single-buffer versions. + SHA1, SHA256, SHA512, MD5 - Multi-hash - Get
the performance of multi-buffer hashing with a single-buffer interface.
- Multi-hash + murmur - run both together. - AES - block ciphers + XTS,
GCM, CBC - Rolling hash - Hash input in a window which moves through the
input

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: autoconf
dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools

dependencies.name: automake
dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools

dependencies.name: libtool
dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.

dependencies.name: m4
dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.

dependencies.name: yasm
dependencies.description:
Yasm is a complete rewrite of the NASM-2.11.06 assembler. It supports
the x86 and AMD64 instruction sets, accepts NASM and GAS assembler
syntaxes and outputs binary, ELF32 and ELF64 object formats.

dependencies.name: nasm
dependencies.description:
NASM (Netwide Assembler) is an 80x86 assembler designed for portability
and modularity. It includes a disassembler as well.

dependent_to.name: daos
dependent_to.description:
The Distributed Asynchronous Object Storage (DAOS) is an open-source
software-defined object store designed from the ground up for massively
distributed Non Volatile Memory (NVM).
